name: Upright Row with Dumbbells
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.

2. Keeping your back straight, engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine.

3. Bend at the waist and let the dumbbells hang straight down from your hands, keeping your arms fully extended and your elbows locked.

4. Slowly lift the dumbbells upwards, keeping them close to your body, until the tops of the dumbbells are at knee-level or slightly higher.

5. Squeeze your shoulder blades together as you lift the dumbbells.

6. Pause briefly at the top of the movement.

7. Slowly lower the dumbbells down to the starting position, keeping control throughout the movement.

8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Upright rows with dumbbells are a strength training exercise that primarily works the shoulders and can be performed without any equipment other than dumbbells.
